title.narrative: Improved Management Strategies for Cocoa in Papua New Guinea

description.narrative: Despite growing global demand for cocoa and the economic importance of the crop, the cocoa industry in Papua New Guinea (PNG) is in crisis, with production in East New Britain Province (ENBP; the province formerly with the highest production) plummeting by 82% between 2008 and 2012. The main cause is cocoa pod borer (CPB). this new project aims to support the sustainable intensification of cocoa production in PNG through the evaluation and dissemination of new options to enhance productivity and profitability. Primary scientific outputs of the project will include versatile and region-specific extension guidelines for intensified cocoa management, involving CPB tolerant/resistant cocoa germplasm, improved pest and disease management (frequent and complete harvesting, pruning, sanitation, etc), improved soil fertility, and recommendations to improve cocoa quality and market access.
